meanings.definition: A type of garment worn on the feet to cover and protect them.
meanings.sent1: I put on my cozy serks before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: Her colorful serks matched her outfit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept stealing my serks and running around the house with them.
meanings.sent4: His lucky serks seemed to bring him good fortune wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The old man's worn-out serks told the story of his long journey through life.

meanings.definition: To search for something diligently and persistently.
meanings.sent1: She serks through the library for her favorite book.
meanings.sent2: The detective serks for clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent3: The kids serks for hidden treasures in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: He serks for the truth behind the strange occurrences in the town.
meanings.sent5: The explorer serks the jungle for rare plants and animals.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Sweden.
meanings.sent1: He exchanged his dollars for Swedish serks at the bank.
meanings.sent2: The souvenir shop accepted both euros and serks as payment.
meanings.sent3: The tourist was surprised by the value of the Swedish serks compared to her own currency.
meanings.sent4: The local market displayed prices in both serks and euros for the convenience of tourists.
meanings.sent5: She saved up her serks to buy a special gift for her friend.
